text: <@U1M7K67EV>: we have similar issue tracked in github <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/issues/2346> but this was closed couple days.. @tuan suspected this could be docker version issue in jenkins

text: <@U0UHG4VP1>: please install <https://wiki.jenkins-ci.org/display/JENKINS/Conditional+BuildStep+Plugin>
<@U11HH3P7Y>: it was already installed, but I ran the update. The update requires a Jenkins restart, so it will be a little bit for the very latest version to be installed
Thanks ry. I am planning to submit patch for ci skip.
In what cases?
when commit message is having ci skip
Why is this coming up?
skip build when user submits only documentation changes..
Sounds dangerous
earlier with github and jenkins we have this feature.. so, thought of implementing this..
<@U0UHG4VP1>: <@U11HH3P7Y> Thanks, hopefully that fixes it when Jenkins gets restarted :slightly_smiling_face:
I’ve restarted Jenkins (hours ago, actually)
Great! I'll be keeping an eye on the tests to see how they go then :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U1M7K67EV>: <@U0UHG4VP1> has installed conditional buildStep plugin in jenkins..
Docker version in jenkins is 1.8.. I think we have to upgrade to 1.12..
Tuan suggested to upgrade docker version in jenkins to 1.11 or 1.12.. but I am suspecting behave code for not clearing IP list..
<@U11HH3P7Y>: I hope to have docker upgraded Friday
sure <@U0UHG4VP1>.. This issue is inconsistently failing.. we can wait till that..
Sweet, thanks <@U0UHG4VP1>
jcarrivick: are you going to be working on JJB in the near future?
Sorry, what's JJB? That probably answers your question though haha
OK :slightly_smiling_face:
Jenkins Job Builder, the YAML that defines our builds is consumed by a plugin named JJB
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/gitweb?p=ci-management.git;a=summary> for instance. if you aren’t going to be working on CI it doesn’t matter :slightly_smiling_face:
Ah ok. Yeah I wasn't going to be. I'm happy to help out if you would like me to though!
I haven't had any experience with it before
how is your prolog?
never used it before >.<
in this we are equal
